items.title: Thailand, Baidu partner to rebuild Chinese tourist confidence
items.summary:
- Thailand's Tourism Authority has teamed up with Baidu to enhance its appeal to Chinese tourists after safety issues.
- The partnership, initiated on Feb. 27, employs digital marketing and AI to combat negative perceptions.
- A recent incident involving the disappearance of Chinese actor Wang Xing affected bookings during the Lunar New Year.
- Thailand aims to attract more quality Chinese tourists by 2025, seeking to return to pre-pandemic tourist levels of 40 million by the end of that year.
- In 2024, Thailand received 6.73 million Chinese visitors among 35.54 million international arrivals, with tourism contributing significantly to the economy.

items.title: 20 largest exits in SEA
TikTok to invest $8.8b in Thai data centers by 2029
items.author: Helena Lersch
items.summary:
- TikTok plans to invest US$8.8 billion in data centers in Thailand over the next five years.
- Announcement made by vice president Helena Lersch during an event in Bangkok on Feb. 28.
- The connection to a prior US$3.8 billion agreement with Thailand’s investment board is unclear.

items.title: Tencent launches new AI model to rival DeepSeek
items.summary:
- Tencent has launched the AI model Hunyuan Turbo S, which responds to user queries faster than DeepSeek’s R1 model, with a response time of under one second.
- Hunyuan Turbo S performs on par with DeepSeek’s V3 in terms of knowledge, mathematics, and reasoning capabilities.
- DeepSeek’s V3 powers their popular AI chatbot, which leads in app store downloads.
- DeepSeek has not yet responded to Tencent’s claims regarding the Turbo S.

items.title: Alibaba to hire 3,000 interns with focus on AI roles
items.summary:
- Alibaba Group is launching a hiring campaign for 3,000 internships, focusing nearly half on AI roles.
- The program targets students graduating between November 2025 and October 2026 across various business units.
- Over 80% of the AI-focused internships will be within Alibaba Cloud, amid a workforce shortage in China prompted by rising AI demand.

items.title: Bitcoin tumbles to $80k for first time since November
items.summary:
- Bitcoin dropped below US$80,000 on Feb. 28, reaching US$79,666.
- The decline marks its lowest point since Nov. 11, 2024, with a decrease of over 5% in one day.
- The drop in value is attributed to reduced optimism for US digital currency support and uncertainty regarding President Trump’s tariff plans.
- Bitcoin's market value has decreased by approximately 25% since its peak of over US$105,000 in mid-December.
- The situation is worsened by a US$1.5 billion hack of rival cryptocurrency ether.

items.title: EFishery ex-CEO calls billion-rupiah salary claim ‘untrue’
items.author: Gibran Huzaifah
items.summary:
[ Gibran Huzaifah denies claims of a gross monthly salary of 1.28 billion rupiah (US$74,951) for 2024. ]
[ Tech in Asia found Huzaifah's documented salary to be approximately 313 million rupiah (US$19,138) monthly, a quarter of the reported figure. ]
[ It's uncertain how the inflated salary figure was calculated; Huzaifah's bonuses reportedly range from one to two months' salary, requiring board approval. ]

items.title: Asian chip stocks drop as Nvidia slumps after earnings miss
items.summary:
- Asian chip stocks fell significantly following Nvidia's disappointing earnings report.
- Nvidia's share price declined by 10% as it missed revenue expectations.
- The slump in Asian chip stocks raises concerns about the overall semiconductor market performance.

items.title: IBM completes $6.4b cloud automation acquisition
items.summary:
- IBM finalized its acquisition of HashiCorp for US$6.4 billion on Feb. 27, at US$35 per share in cash.
- This acquisition enhances IBM's hybrid cloud and automation capabilities, incorporating HashiCorp’s infrastructure automation and security tools.
- HashiCorp’s Terraform and Vault will integrate with IBM’s existing technologies, such as Red Hat and watsonx, to improve IT infrastructure and security processes.
- The deal aims to support enterprises in managing hybrid cloud environments by combining public cloud services with on-premises data centers.
- IBM anticipates a demand surge for scalable infrastructure automation, forecasting 1 billion new cloud-native applications by 2028 due to generative AI.

items.title: IBM to shut another Chinese subsidiary, impacting 1,800 jobs
items.summary:
- IBM will close its subsidiary, IBM Business Machines (China) Investment Co., on March 1, 2025.
- The closure will affect over 1,800 employees in cities like Beijing, Shanghai, and Dalian.
- The decision follows a previous announcement to relocate China-based R&D activities and a significant decline in financial performance in the region with a revenue drop of 19.6% in 2023.

items.title: Taiwanese AI firm Crescendo Lab expands to Singapore
items.summary:
- Crescendo Lab expands operations to Singapore.
- The company provides AI-driven conversational commerce solutions.
- Aims to enhance customer engagement and operations using WhatsApp integration.
- Over 80% of Singapore’s population uses WhatsApp.
- Crescendo Lab has established presence in Taiwan, Japan, and Thailand.
- Singapore is the latest hub for conversational commerce in Southeast Asia.

items.title: Meta to launch standalone AI app in 2025, eyes monetization
items.summary:
- Meta Platforms plans to launch a standalone app for its Meta AI assistant in Q2 2025.
- The app aims to offer deeper interaction and personalization, potentially integrating with Meta’s smart glasses.
- Meta is considering a paid subscription model for Meta AI, similar to competitors' offerings.
- This initiative follows similar launches by Google's Gemini and xAI’s Grok, as the AI market sees significant competition.
- The company declined to comment on the details of the app or monetization strategies.

items.title: Stripe reaches $91.5b valuation through tender offer
items.summary:
- Payments technology company Stripe has raised its valuation to US$91.5 billion through a tender offer for employees and shareholders.
- This represents a 41% increase from last year's valuation of US$65 billion.
- The tender offer comes as Stripe reports continued profitability, projected to last through 2025.
- Stripe facilitates payment processing for businesses including Amazon, Hertz Global, and Instacart.

items.title: Meta fires 20 employees for sharing confidential information
items.author: null
items.summary:
- Meta has terminated about 20 employees for sharing confidential information externally.
- The dismissals followed an internal investigation.
- Meta warns of potential further action if additional leaks are discovered.
- Spokesperson Dave Arnold stated leaking information violates company policy, regardless of intent.
- Meta has not disclosed specific details about the leaked information or identities involved.

items.title: Ola Electric shuts down warehouses to cut costs
items.summary:
- Ola Electric has closed all regional warehouses in India to streamline distribution.
- The company will rely on its 4,000 retail stores for inventory management and deliveries.
- This strategy aims to boost operational efficiency and increase EBITDA margins by 10 points, saving about 30 crore rupees monthly (approx. US$34.35 million).
- Ola Electric is also renegotiating agreements with vehicle registration agencies to further lower costs.

items.title: Meta in talks to secure $35b funding for data centers
items.summary:
- Apollo Global Management is in discussions to lead a $35 billion funding for Meta Platforms.
- The funding aims to support the development of data centers in the U.S.
- Discussions are still in early stages and no deal has been confirmed yet.

items.title: Duolingo forecasts up to $978.5m revenue in 2025
items.summary:
- Duolingo forecasts 2025 annual revenue between US$962.5 million and US$978.5 million, above analysts' estimate of US$965.9 million.
- Shares rose by about 4% in after-hours trading following the announcement.
- For Q1 2025, the expected revenue is between US$220.5 million and US$223.5 million.
- The company operates on a freemium model, with premium tiers including a generative AI feature for video calls.
- AI-driven features have attracted more subscribers but increased costs, impacting gross margins by about 100 basis points.
- Duolingo anticipates reduced costs over time due to a focus on innovation and engagement.
- Adjusted core profit for 2025 is forecasted between US$259.9 million and US$274 million, slightly below analysts' expectations of US$272.1 million due to AI-related expenses.

items.title: Paytm, Perplexity partner to add AI search in payment app
items.summary:
- Paytm partners with AI search engine Perplexity to enhance its mobile payment app with AI-driven features.
- New AI-powered search bar will allow users to ask questions and receive personalized financial insights.
- Future features may include portfolio management, savings tracking, and expenditure monitoring tools.

items.title: India’s Startup Policy Forum teams up with university for research
items.summary:
- India’s Startup Policy Forum (SPF) signed an MoU with IIT Madras for data-driven policy research.
- Partnership announced on Feb. 27 to strengthen ties between academia and industry.
- Focus on startup financing, innovation, and evidence-based policymaking.
- Initiative includes policy discussions, research workshops, and roundtables for supporting startups and entrepreneurs.

items.title: OpenAI launches new GPT-4.5
items.summary:
- OpenAI has announced the release of its new AI model, GPT-4.5.
- Currently accessible to Pro tier users; Plus tier users will experience a delay.
- OpenAI plans to add tens of thousands of GPUs next week to improve access.

items.title: SG charges 3 people with fraud in Nvidia chip export case
items.summary:
- Singapore authorities charged three individuals with fraud related to the illegal export of Nvidia chips to China.
- The charges followed raids on February 26, targeting 22 locations, resulting in nine arrests and the seizure of documentary and electronic records.
- The accused include two Singaporeans, Aaron Woon Guo Jie and Alan Wei Zhaolun, facing criminal conspiracy charges, and Li Ming, a Chinese national charged with fraud by false representation.
- The chips were allegedly used by AI firm DeepSeek, which is under investigation by the US Commerce Department for potential violations of export controls.

items.title: BYD tops Hyundai in Indonesia’s EV race, but the fight isn’t over
items.summary:
- Hyundai's sales of EVs in Indonesia dropped significantly from over 7,000 units in 2023 to only 2,800 units in 2024.
- BYD surpassed Hyundai by selling 15,000 EV units in the same period, indicating a shift in market dominance.
- Local government incentives and upcoming factory constructions have positioned BYD favorably in the Indonesian EV market.
- Hyundai's top-selling Ioniq 5 saw a decrease in sales to about 1,500 units in 2024, nearly five times less than the previous year.
- There is skepticism about the long-term sustainability of the pure EV market in Indonesia, leading to a shift towards hybrid models among automakers.

items.title: ID to inject $20b into sovereign wealth fund yearly: prez envoy
items.author: Hashim Djojohadikusumo
items.summary:
- The Indonesian government plans to allocate US$20 billion yearly to Danantara, its new sovereign wealth fund, during President Prabowo Subianto’s term.
- Announcement made by Hashim Djojohadikusumo on Feb. 27.
- Danantara will collaborate with investors like Ray Dalio’s Bridgewater, potentially managing investments worth up to US$160 billion annually.
- Initially involved consolidating seven state-owned enterprises but expanded to include all SOEs and subsidiaries.
- Recent developments include appointments and audits to ensure transparency.

items.title: Dubai venture builder Disrupt.com unveils $100m fund
items.author: Aaqib Gadit, Uzair Gadit, Umair Gadit
items.summary:
- Disrupt.com, based in Dubai, has launched a $100 million fund for AI-focused startups globally.
- The firm supports early-stage ventures in various sectors including AI, cybersecurity, Web 3.0, automotive tech, and retail innovation.
- The fund targets startups at pre-seed to series A stages with significant growth potential and profitability paths.
- Disrupt.com has previously invested over $40 million in both growth and early-stage companies.

items.title: inDrive launches Shariah-compliant loans for ID drivers
items.summary:
- On Feb. 27, inDrive launched its first fintech service, inDrive.Money, in the Asia-Pacific region.
- The service is developed with Singapore-based Fingular and Ammana, an Indonesian peer-to-peer lending platform that follows Shariah principles.
- Drivers can access loans up to 10 million rupiah (around US$607) via the inDrive app for urgent expenses like vehicle repairs.
- Funding is managed by Ammana, with repayments made from ride earnings over three to five months.
- The service charges a 10 to 15% commission on rides, with monthly payments based on ride frequency and income.
- The pilot phase started in late 2024, available in cities such as Jakarta, Surabaya, Bandung, and Makassar.
- Indonesia is a crucial market for inDrive, which plans further expansion of its fintech services in the country.

items.title: A startup watchdog for Indonesia?
items.summary:
- Indonesia’s startup ecosystem faces scandals, notably involving eFishery and TaniFund.
- Calls for a dedicated regulatory body arise to improve oversight and reduce fraud.
- Alternatives suggested include strengthening roles of existing institutions or private sector solutions.
- Significant investor confidence issues are noted due to recent fraud cases.

items.title: These are the most active investors in Hong Kong’s startups
items.summary:
- The article discusses the most active investors in Hong Kong's startups over the past 12 months.
- It features firms that have invested in three or more Hong Kong-based companies in the specified timeframe.
- The data is continually updated, and details can be submitted for corrections via email.

items.title: Indian laundry startup Quick Clean nets $6m in funding
items.summary:
- Quick Clean secures ₹52 crore (US$6 million) in its first funding round.
- Investment co-led by Alkemi Growth Capital and Blue Ashva Capital, with an additional ₹10 crore (US$1.1 million) in debt.
- Founded in 2010, Quick Clean provides laundry solutions to hospitals and hotels across 35+ cities in India, serving clients like Taj and Marriott.
- Partners with global brands like LG and Electrolux for advanced laundry solutions.

items.title: AI firm Bridgetown Research secures $19m series A
items.author: Harsh Sahai
items.summary:
- Bridgetown Research raised US$19 million in a series A funding round.
- The funding round was led by Lightspeed Venture Partners and Accel, with participation from a research university.
- This funding values the Seattle-based startup at US$250 million.
- Bridgetown Research develops AI agents to collect proprietary data from expert input and customer surveys.
- The startup plans to enhance its AI agents' analytical capabilities with the new funding.

items.title: UK’s organ-preservation tech firm OrganOx raises $142m
items.summary:
- OrganOx raised US$142 million in a funding round led by HealthQuest Capital.
- The company has developed a technology that extends liver preservation time to up to 24 hours, nearly double that of traditional methods.
- OrganOx's platform has been used in over 5,000 liver transplants worldwide and aims to explore kidney transplant applications in the future.

items.title: The 50 top-funded AI startups in Asia
items.summary:
- The article lists AI companies in Asia with the highest funding.
- Data is based on Tech in Asia’s research, focusing on companies that raised money in the past two years.
- The list aims to identify companies likely to have a global impact based on their funding levels.

items.title: Xiaomi founder Lei Jun now China’s richest
items.author: null
items.summary:
- Xiaomi’s founder and CEO Lei Jun is now the richest person in China with estimated wealth of 440 billion yuan (around US$60.6 billion).
- His wealth largely comes from a 24.2% stake in Xiaomi, valued at approximately 341.2 billion yuan (around US$46.99 billion).
- Xiaomi's shares rose nearly 6%, pushing the company's market value over HK$1.4 trillion (about US$180 billion) and setting a record high stock price of HK$56.8 (around US$7.3).
- Since October 2022, Xiaomi's stock has increased by over 570% from a low of HK$8.31 (around US$1.07).
- Analysts remain optimistic about Xiaomi's prospects, with Goldman Sachs raising its price target for the company's stock from HK$38 (around US$4.89) to HK$58 (around US$7.46).

items.title: PH fintech Maya achieved profitability in 2024
items.summary:
- Maya, a leading digital banking platform in the Philippines, reported significant growth and is on track to achieve profitability by December 2024.
- The customer base reached 5.4 million, a 71% increase year-on-year, with loans nearly doubling to 1.6 million borrowers.
- Deposits grew to 39 billion peso (US$673.4 million), marking a 59% year-on-year increase, while cumulative loan disbursements totaled 92 billion peso (US$1.6 billion).

items.title: Uber launches private car ride-sharing service in India
items.summary:
- Uber launches a ride-sharing service in Assam, India, allowing private car owners to become drivers.
- This is Uber's first initiative in India to allow vehicles with white number plates to operate as taxis.
- The initial rollout will feature women and army veterans as drivers to promote inclusivity.
- The pilot project aims to encourage other Indian states to permit private vehicles for shared rides.
- The model faces challenges and resistance from unions in India, which is new compared to the US and UK.

items.title: Ex-Twitter CEO’s VC firm seeks $400m for fifth fund
items.author: Evan Williams
items.summary:
- Obvious Ventures, co-founded by Evan Williams, is seeking to raise $400 million for its fifth fund.
- This fund comes after a previous fundraising of $355 million in 2022, which was short of its $400 million target.
- The firm, established in 2014, has invested in companies like Beyond Meat and focuses on planetary health, human health, and economic health.

items.title: India’s upGrad launches $11.45m AI incubator for startups
items.summary:
- Mumbai-based edtech firm upGrad has launched the ‘upGrad AI Incubator’ with an investment of 100 crore rupees (US$11.45 million) to support 5-6 AI startups.
- The incubator will provide infrastructure and seed funding to promote innovation.
- UpGrad's first investment goes to Bengaluru-based startup ZuAI, with undisclosed financial terms.
- UpGrad is partnering with Maharashtra’s government to establish AI excellence centers with a planned investment of 2,150 crore rupees (US$246.73 million).
- Founded in 2015, upGrad offers online and hybrid skilling programs, collaborating with global universities.

items.title: Chipmaker firm Onsemi to cut 2,400 jobs by 2025
items.summary:
- Onsemi plans to eliminate approximately 2,400 jobs by 2025 as part of a global restructuring plan.
- The decision was announced in a company filing on February 25, aimed at reducing operational costs.
- The restructuring is expected to cost between US$50 million and US$60 million, mainly recorded within this fiscal year.
- Annual savings from this plan are anticipated to be between US$105 million and US$115 million.

items.title: Indian court fines Amazon $38.9m for trademark violation
items.summary:
- The Delhi High Court fined Amazon 339.3 crore rupees (US$38.89 million) for trademark infringement concerning the Beverly Hills Polo Club (BHPC) logo.
- The penalty includes 292.7 crore rupees for lost royalties, 43.33 crore rupees for increased advertising costs, and 3.23 crore rupees in additional fees.
- The court previously instructed Amazon to remove infringing products within 72 hours and a similar ruling was made by the UK Supreme Court in March 2024.

items.title: US maternity startup Millie nets $12m series A
items.author: Anu Sharma
items.summary:
- Millie, a maternity clinic in California, has raised $12 million in its series A funding round.
- The investment was led by RH Capital, TMV, and Pivotal Ventures, founded by Melinda French Gates.
- Established by Anu Sharma in 2019, Millie launched in 2022, providing maternity and gynecology services, including mental health support.
- The clinic offers a combination of in-person and virtual care, along with a tech platform for patient monitoring, and collaborates with major insurance providers.
- Millie aims to expand its services across California and improve its technology offerings, having raised nearly $19 million in total funding.

items.title: Chip design software firm Synopsys forecasts $1.62b Q2 revenue
items.summary:
- Synopsys projects Q2 2025 revenue between US$1.59 billion and US$1.62 billion, surpassing Wall Street estimates.
- Midpoint forecast slightly exceeds analysts' expectations of US$1.60 billion.
- Anticipated earnings per share are between US$3.37 and US$3.42, above predictions of US$3.35.
- Following the forecast, Synopsys shares rose by 2.45% to US$482 in after-hours trading.
- Increased demand driven by companies like Amazon, Google, and Apple for proprietary chip development.
- Growth in AI chip development noted as a contributing factor by CEO Sassine Ghazi.

items.title: Google cuts staff in cloud division as AI investment grows
items.summary:
- Google has laid off fewer than 100 employees in its cloud division, primarily in sales operations.
- The layoffs are part of strategic adjustments to focus on AI and meet customer demands for long-term growth.
- This decision follows slow growth in Google Cloud's earnings and the tech industry's trend of layoffs while balancing AI investments with profitability.

items.title: Snowflake expands AI push, forecasts 24% of revenue growth
items.summary:
- Snowflake Inc. expects a 24% increase in product revenue for FY ending January 2026, reaching $4.28 billion, surpassing analysts’ estimates of $4.23 billion.
- In Q4, product revenue grew 28% to $943.3 million, exceeding expected $915.8 million; customers spending over $1 million annually rose to 580.
- The company is expanding AI capabilities, integrating models from OpenAI and Anthropic, according to CEO Sridhar Ramaswamy.
- Remaining performance obligations hit $6.9 billion, higher than the $6.67 billion estimate.
- Shares rose 9% in after-hours trading following a close of $166.19 that day.

items.title: Instagram considers separate Reels app
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Instagram is contemplating a standalone app for its short-form video feature, Reels.
- Internal meetings regarding this were led by Adam Mosseri, head of Instagram.
- The move aims to attract users amid uncertainty surrounding TikTok’s future in the U.S.
- The potential app intends to replicate TikTok’s video-scrolling experience.

items.title: SG quantum computing firm explores $500m public merger
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Horizon Quantum Computing and dMY Squared Technology Group have signed a non-binding letter of intent to explore a potential merger.
- The merger aims to create a publicly listed company led by CEO Joe Fitzsimons.
- The LOI values Horizon Quantum at $500 million pre-money, with a target to finalize a definitive agreement by Q2 2025 and close the transaction by year-end.
- The merger is subject to due diligence, board and shareholder approvals, and regulatory clearances.
- Horizon Quantum develops advanced software tools for quantum computing, including a quantum operating system for practical applications.

items.title: Indian cross border fintech startup nets $2m seed funding
items.author: Dewang Neralla, Geeta Chauhan, Ujwal Tamminedi
items.summary:
- Mumbai-based payments platform HiWiPay raises US$2 million in seed funding led by Unicorn India Ventures.
- Funding will be used to expand trade remittance services and operations in education remittance sector.
- HiWiPay aims for US$100 million in transaction volume in the next 12 to 18 months.
- Partnership with over 500 education consultants to onboard 5,000 international students in 18 months.
- Plans to launch a student app in the UK and enter the SME trade remittance market.

items.title: Kredivo takes over GajiGesa in $12m deal: source
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Kredivo has acquired Indonesian earned-wage access startup GajiGesa for approximately $12 million.
- GajiGesa will continue to operate as a separate brand within Kredivo Group.
- Discussions regarding the acquisition began in March 2024 when GajiGesa sought a partnership for its salary disbursements.
- GajiGesa, founded in 2020, now serves over 350,000 employees across 400 enterprises, helping them access wages early.
- The startup has raised $9.1 million in funding from investors like MassMutual Ventures and Wagestream.

items.title: Toyota completes first phase of futuristic ‘Woven City’
items.summary:
- Toyota has completed the first phase of its ‘Woven City,’ a prototype urban area in Japan designed for advanced technology integration.
- The city spans over 700,000 square meters and features dedicated roads for autonomous vehicles, multiple transportation modes, and pedestrian pathways.
- Construction started in 2021, with plans for logistics via an underground passageway and safety evaluations for various modes of transport.
- Approximately 360 residents, including employees and families, are expected to move in later this year, with an eventual population target of around 2,000 residents.

items.title: Zepto expands dark stores, opens first women-only outlet
items.summary:
- Zepto has expanded in India with over 20 dark stores located in Coimbatore, Tiruchirappalli, Madurai, Vellore, and Salem.
- Launched its first women-only dark store, strategically placed within 2-3 km for quick delivery at speeds of 15-20 km/h.
- Partnered with 100+ local farmers for sourcing regional products like tender coconuts and green vegetables.
- Offers various regional products alongside national and global brands.
- Competition in quick commerce is increasing with rivals like Blinkit and Swiggy Instamart expanding their operations.

items.title: Vietnam-based agritech firm Techcoop secures $70m series A
items.summary:
- Techcoop announced a $70 million series A funding round on Feb. 24.
- Funding consists of $28 million in equity and $42 million in debt financing.
- Co-led by TNB Aura and AVV, with participation from BlueOrchard, FMO, AppWorks, and Capria Ventures.
- Investment aimed at enhancing Techcoop’s digital platform and export infrastructure for crops like cashew nuts, coconut, and coffee.
- The company intends to expand technology and improve sustainable farming practices.
- Techcoop has been profitable since its launch in 2022 and targets $130 million in annual revenue by the end of 2024.

items.title: Spotify CEO criticizes Apple over EU compliance failures
items.author: Daniel Ek
items.summary:
- Spotify CEO Daniel Ek accuses Apple of failing to comply with the EU’s Digital Markets Act (DMA), calling it a “farce.”
- Criticism directed at Apple for a “pattern of delaying and stalling” during a meeting with European Commission officials.
- DMA could impose fines of up to 10% of a company’s global revenue for non-compliance, with a decision on Apple's compliance expected by the end of March.
- Ek notes that Apple’s plans for alternative app stores still impose harmful fees on developers.
- The EU fined Apple €1.8 billion over restrictive App Store practices, and investigations are ongoing.
- US President Donald Trump has threatened retaliatory tariffs against the EU over the fines.
